DataElement.preferredName: Primary Tumor Post Excision Remaining Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator to ask if tissue from a primary tumor was left in the patient after a surgical resection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to residual primary tumor following resection, removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Removal or excision by surgical measures.:Remaining; enduring or persisting.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Enduring or persisting; residual, left over or behind.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Has residual primary tumor been detected (after resection)?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Was any persistent, viable tumor detected?
